Key Match Events: Minnesota rallied late from a 4-0 deficit to force extra innings before losing 8-6 to the Braves.
The Twins suffered their seventh loss in nine games.
A frenzied late-innings comeback sent the game to extra innings.
The Twins' bullpen had two huge implosions that turned victory into defeat on the last road trip.
Edouard Julien's defensive misplay completely flipped Sunday’s ninth inning.
Ryan Jeffers’ liner up the middle turned into a carom off the pitcher and a popout.
Max Kepler pulled up at third instead of heeding the green light to score on a double.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Rocco Baldelli emphasized the need for the team to dig deep and muster up a turnaround.
Ryan Jeffers acknowledged the increased pressure as the season comes to an end.
Baldelli expressed confidence in the team's ability to bounce back despite recent losses.
Jeffers stated that the team believes in itself and knows it needs to play better.
